chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat

Goal:
0 < n -> power n 0 = 0

Premises:
Notation power := (mscal Init.Nat.mul 1)
power_0 : forall x : nat, power 0 x = 1
power_S : forall n x : nat, power (S n) x = x * power n x
Init.Nat.sqrt = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.sqrt_iter n 0 0 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sqrt _%nat_scope
power_1 : forall x : nat, power 1 x = x
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
gcd.euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope
Nat.sqrt_up = fun a : nat => match 0 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.sqrt (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.sqrt_up _%nat_scope
gcd.divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
f_equal2_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> nat -> B) (x1 y1 x2 y2 : nat), x1 = y1 -> x2 = y2 -> f x1 x2 = f y1 y2
msum_msum : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n k : nat) (f : nat -> nat -> X), (forall i1 j1 i2 j2 : nat, i1 < n -> j1 < k -> i2 < n -> j2 < k -> m (f i1 j1) (f i2 j2) = m (f i2 j2) (f i1 j1)) -> msum m u n (fun i : nat => msum m u k (f i)) = msum m u k (fun j : nat => msum m u n (fun i : nat => f i j))
Nat.log2_up = fun a : nat => match 1 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.log2 (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.log2_up _%nat_scope
gcd.bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ gcd.is_gcd p q g /\ gcd.is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
gcd.bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> gcd.is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => 0%Z | S n0 => Z.pos (Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
msum_0 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (f : nat -> X), msum m u 0 f = u
binomial = fix binomial (n p : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => match p with | 0 => 1 | S _ => 0 end | S n0 => match p with | 0 => 1 | S p0 => binomial n0 p0 + binomial n0 (S p0) end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments binomial (_ _)%nat_scope
binomial_0n : forall n : nat, 0 < n -> binomial 0 n = 0
gcd.is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides p r /\ gcd.divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides p k -> gcd.divides q k -> gcd.divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
gcd.is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides r p /\ gcd.divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides k p -> gcd.divides k q -> gcd.divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope

```coq

rewrite power_0.
auto.
Qed.
